title: Deus Ex: Game of the Year Edition

title: Deus Ex: Game of the Year Edition
notes: Running in windowed mode works best, otherwise alt-tabbing will crash the game. Also noticed strange mouse movement issues that went away when going to windowed mode. Running under DX9 and not OpenGL is recommended.
specs: AMD FX(tm)-6120 Six-Core / AMD ATI Radeon HD 7970/8970

title: Deus Ex: Game of the Year Edition
Deus Ex: Game of the Year Edition
notes: Weird mouse bug when played in non native-fullscreen. Crashes when alt-tabbing while in fullscreen. Shows desktop cursor on top of the game cursor when windowed.

title: Deus Ex: Game of the Year Edition
notes: Seems to work. Has sound. Mouse cursor "jumps"/moves when clicking in main menu resolutions lower than 1024x768. Higher resolutions such as 1920x1080 corrupt screen. Brightness settings do not work. Tested both default OpenGL and DirectX renders. Third-party Kentie's DX10 render crashes the game. Might require winetricks DX10 DLLs and something more?

title: Deus Ex: Game of the Year Edition
notes: Works out-of-box after disabling Wayland (mouse cursor was bugged on Wayland)

title: Deus Ex: Game of the Year Edition

gpu: Intel Open Source Technology Center Mesa DRI Intel(R) Sandybridge Mobile x86/MMX/SSE2
notes:
Runs reasonably well on my old hardware out of the box, but the framerate is rather spotty. Installing a third party launcher with an OpenGL renderer (http://kentie.net/article/dxguide/) made the framerate consistent and the game perfectly playable. I imagine that more powerful machines will not have this problem.

I managed to install the GMDX mod on this installation but, I needed to manually manage some files (see here: https://www.reddit.com/r/Deusex/comments/9c2ele/failed_to_enter_dxdx_trying_to_get_gmdx_to_work/e57mojf/). This modded copy worked perfectly under Steam Play. However, you cannot launch separate mods with this method as you need to reinstall Deus Ex clean each time for each mod you want.
title: Deus Ex: Game of the Year Edition

notes: using the Deus Exe Tweak from http://kentie.net/article/dxguide/index.htm it runs in 4k flawlessly
